title: Black hole event horizons are cosmologically coupled
abstract:
It is shown that an exactly static and spherically symmetric black hole event
horizon cannot be embedded in a time-dependent geometry. Forcing it to do so
results in a naked null singularity at the would-be horizon. Therefore, since
the universe is expanding, black holes must couple to the cosmological
expansion, which was suggested as the growth mechanism for supermassive black
holes in galaxies, with implications for the dark energy puzzle.
